Articles.Content:
Sector 7 Space Laboratories - Aeronautics Division

Mini Tommy & Tommy Mig

The Tommy Mig was release with The Motherload Challenge, a very sturdy and great handling craft even at full warp speed without coming apart, it has plenty of flight time. Not anything spectacular but might fit into a project for someone like maybe an Aircraft Carrier. The Mini Tommy 2 has the Whiplash Engine and is very quick and the 3 has the Rapier. Landing them requires a very slow speed near 25 m/s works.

Tommy Mig

Mini Tommy

Top Speed

Mini Tommy 2

Top Speed

Mini Tommy 3

Top Speed
Those are some very tiny planes! I like the mini tommy the most, although sinking the battery pack / reaction wheels into the cockpit would help the aesthetics, I think.

Good idea! I didn't know that could be done, it would look better. I've seen many ways to do things like that but didn't think to try it. Thanks for the tip...... I was just looking at the Tommy Mig and thought about putting a breather on the front to look more like the Mig, I will make these changes and post a picture later to see the difference.

Edited October 30, 2015 by castille7

After the redesign and testing although the craft looks better with the twin engines as the original Tomcat the performance is not good. The craft file is with a single Whiplash which has really nice handling.

The Craft File

Mini Tommy II

- - - Updated - - -

The Mini Mig remake looks better and performance is about the same. Converting the Mini Tommy craft to a Mini Mig is easy enough so I didn't bother with the craft file.
